description: Rotate clumps using right-hand rule. Application with the point keyword may also modify the center of mass location. Rotations follow the right-hand rule where the rotation axis in 2D is toward the viewer. Rotations are not allowed that rotate clumps so that pebble centroids fall outside the model domain. No clumps will be rotated if any clumps fail this test. Should orientation tracking be active, then the orientation is updated by default, though this can be disabled via the update-orientation keyword.

keywords.name: axis
keywords.description: Axis of rotation (required). Vector specifying the rotation axis

keywords.name: angle
keywords.description: Angle of rotation in degrees using the right-hand-rule (required)

keywords.name: point
keywords.description: Rotation occurs about the specified point. If absent, rotation occurs about the centroid of each clump. When used, may modify center of mass location

keywords.name: update-orientation
keywords.description: Explicitly set the orientation update status for this rotate command. Used if orientation tracking is enabled to update the orientation. Default: true (orientation is updated)

notes: In 2D, the rotation axis is toward the viewer
Rotations not allowed if pebble centroids would fall outside model domain
If ANY clump fails rotation test, NO clumps are rotated (all-or-nothing behavior)
When orientation tracking is active, orientation is updated by default
With point keyword: rotation center is specified point (may modify center of mass location)
Without point keyword: each clump rotates about its own centroid

examples.description: Rotate all clumps 45° about y-axis through each clump's centroid

examples.command: clump rotate axis (0,0,1) angle 90 range id 1 100

examples.description: Rotate all clumps 30° about x-axis through origin (may change center of mass locations)

examples.command: clump rotate axis (0,1,0) angle 45 update-orientation false range group 'rock'
examples.description: Rotate clumps in 'rock' group without updating orientation tracking

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('clump rotate ...') - Python SDK does not provide direct clump rotation method
